resources.string: No-frills place offering a big menu of beyond-the-basics Chinese dishes including soup dumplings.
Vintage dim sum parlor dating back to 1920 with a drink menu that includes tea, beer and wine.
Salt-baked seafood, handmade noodles, soups and roast meat are served in a spartan setting.
Fish are plucked from tanks up front at this Cantonese seafood spot also known for a dim sum lunch.
Chinese noodles are made by hand and served in soups and stir-fries at this bustling, bare-bones spot.
Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers, fries and shakes.
An Asian fast food restaurant that has cheap eats with lunch specials and can conveniently deliver right to your doorstep
Hua Ji Pork Chop Fast Food
Tiny, modest Chinese counter-serve spot specializing in pork chops over rice and quick snacks.
Louisiana-accented fast-food chain known for its spicy fried chicken, biscuits and sides.

Straight from their website May Wah Fast Food specializes in soups, “over rice” dishes and noodle soups. Popular “over rice” dishes include their Chicken Leg Over Rice and Pork Chop Over Rice. Popular noodle soups include their Beef Noodle Soup and Shanghai Noodle Soup.
Cozy candy shop offering classic sweet treats plus nuts, dried fruit and house made chocolates.
A Japanese ice cream shop serving inventive flavors in a fish-shaped waffle cone.
Funky dessert cafe with creative shaved ice concoctions and waffles, plus craft coffee drinks and tea.
The Original Chinatown Ice Cream Factory
The flavors range from familiar to exotic (like lychee) at this compact ice-cream shop.
Chinese bakery for cakes, cookies and breads also offering hot and cold specialty drinks.
devoted to presenting and preserving the history, heritage, and culture of Chinese immigrants in the US
NYC\'s largest Buddhist temple; provides services such as formal ceremonies on weekends, fortune telling, weddings, and areas for friends and families of the deceased to pay their respects
an Asian snack paradise for those wishing to satisfy their sweet tooth; sells a variety of dried foods, exotic hard-to-find savory treats, and nostalgic Western treats
a shopping experience with an open-air bazaar feel, complete with vendors willing to bargain
a bar inspired by European apothecaries and resembles a chemistry lab; offers over 250 cocktails, referred to as "prescriptions"
at the heart of Chinatown; has a basketball court, playground, Astroturf field; The north is an area for mah-jongg and card players
founded to serve and protect the interests of the Chinese people in the New York metropolitan area; provides social services, language classes and cultural preservation activities
an occult shop which specializes in feng shui, crystals, and horoscopes; the only place in the city that photographs and reads auras
a modern natural history museum located in a freight elevator; collection of unique artifacts
located on the second floor of an apartment building; This small but lively bar enourages patrons to belt out to the classics while drinking brews on tap
spend a day of relaxation and unwinding; provides spa and beauty services for face and body

From the 1840’s through 1920’s, learn about the earlier era of street gangs of NYC and about the evolution from small packs of immigrant thugs with tightly knit loyalties to an evolved, corporate style American syndicate. Mulberry Street, from Chinatown to Little Italy, is where most of the notorious gangsters in New York rose up. From the former Five Points, New York’s most notorious slum, to the narrow alleys Chinatown’s “Bloody Angle.” In Little Italy’s Historic District we learn the ruthless tactics of the first Mafia bosses of New York, the proud efforts of NYPD Liutenant Joe Petrosino’s fight against these thugs. Organized Crime as we know it was born on these streets.
meets at the corner of Mulberry & Worth streets
serves the Irish, German, Italian and, most recently, Chinese communities; Sunday masses are held in English, Mandarin, and Cantonese; houses a chinese school
an annual celebration of the beginning of the turn of the Chinese lunisolar calendar; features all kinds of vendors, festivities, and food for all ages
East Houston Street to Canal Street

an annual celebration of the end of the autumn harvest; held on the 15th day of the 8th lunar month; features stage performances, cultural arts & crafts, calligraphy, gift booths, moon cake tastings, etc.
Mott Street; between Canal and Beyard Streets

Set at the foot of the Manhattan Bridge in Chinatown, this hip hotel with a midcentury-modern vibe is a 3-minute walk from the Grand Street subway station and an 8-minute walk from the Museum Of Chinese In America. Sleek, contemporary rooms offer complimentary Wi-Fi, iPod docks and flat-screen TVs, in addition to Keurig coffeemakers. Upgraded rooms and 1-bedroom suites add bridge or city views. Off-site parking is available for a fee.

Hotel Mimosa is located in the East Side neighborhood in New York City, just one mile from Ground Zero.All rooms include a flat-screen TV. The rooms have a private bathroom fitted with a bathtub or shower. Extras include free toiletries and a hairdryer. You will find a 24-hour front desk at the property. One World Trade Center is one mile from Hotel Mimosa, and National September 11 Memorial & Museum is 1.1 miles from the property. The nearest airport is LaGuardia Airport, 7 miles from Hotel Mimosa.

Relax in beautifully designed guest rooms and suites with contemporary furnishings, private balconies and floor to ceiling windows with stunning views of the city. Savor seasonal American cuisine at the Wu Room. A recipient of the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence, our modern Manhattan hotel features intimate event space, complimentary Wi-Fi, and a dynamic ambiance where you can meet, lounge and dine in the beautiful Big Apple. Located in an eclectic Lower Manhattan neighborhood, it's easy to explore local nightlife, walk to the trendy shops of SoHo, and dine in Little Italy.

Overlooking Columbus Park, this contemporary Chinatown hotel is 0.3 miles from Little Italy and a 5-minute walk from the nearest subway station. Casual rooms and suites are decorated in a neutral palette with custom furnishings and offer pillow-top mattresses, flat-screen TVs and minifridges; some include terraces and/or city views. High-speed Internet access is available. Perks include free continental breakfast daily, a business center and a modern lobby with seating areas. Several fine and casual dining options are within a block of the hotel.

In Manhattan’s Lower East Side, Hotel 91 is a 5-minute walk from Chinatown and the East Broadway subway station. It offers free wired internet and rooms with flat-screen cable TVs. Guest rooms include desks, hairdryers and alarm clock radios. A wakeup service is available. Hotel 91 offers a 24-hour front desk, ATM, and laundry facilities. Little Italy is a 10-minute walk from Hotel 91 while Ground Zero and South Street Seaport are 20 minutes away. Brooklyn Bridge and Wall Street are less than one mile away.

Located in the Bowery neighborhood in New York City, one mile from One World Trade Center, U.S. Pacific Hotel features air-conditioned rooms with free WiFi throughout the property. Each room is fitted with a flat-screen TV. Ground Zero is one mile from U.S. Pacific Hotel, and National September 11 Memorial & Museum is one mile away. LaGuardia Airport is 7 miles from the property.
The Sun Bright hotel is in the center of Chinatown and one block from Grand St. Subway Station. The hotel offers Wi-Fi and a 24-hour front desk.
Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott New York Manhattan/Downtown

Boasting brand-new, spacious rooms and suites, as well as a convenient location near the New York Stock Exchange, September 11 Memorial and One World Trade Center, Fairfield Inn is the perfect place to explore Manhattan from.

Sleep easy in a comfortable room. You can stay entertained with the free Wi-Fi, DVD player, an iPod docking station, and a flat screen HDTV with over 200 premium channels. If you need to get some work done, take advantage of the work desk and lamp in your room. In the morning, make yourself one of the assorted coffees with the in-room coffee maker.

Whether you're traveling for business or pleasure, New World Hotel offers a variety of room types to ensure comfort for your needs at low prices. Located at the heart of Chinatown, on Bowery, between Hester St. and Grand Street. New World Hotel puts the treasures of Chinatown at your fingertips. Special foods, items, and shops can be found on Canal Street, Mott Street, and Grand Street.

Boasting a shared lounge, Canal Loft Hotel is situated in New York in the New York State region, an 11-minute walk from Bloomingdales. Around 1.2 km from Brooklyn Bridge, the property is also 1.6 km away from Ground Zero and offers free WiFi. The property is a 20-minute walk from One World Trade Center.

Windsor Hotels offer affordable and spacious rooms, each adored with modern amenities and decor. Little Italy is conveniently located within Chinatown and only a few hundred feet away from the hotel. This is also located minutes away from Wall Street, the SOHO District, and the gateway to the Statue of Liberty. In addition, convenient subway stations lead you to the glitter of Times Square, the glamour of the Theatre District, the famous Central Park, shopping at 5th Avenue, the events of Madison Square Garden, and the spirit of the Rockefeller Center.

Manhattan Bowery Lodge is situated in New York, 400 metres from Little Italy and 1.3 km from Brooklyn Bridge.Manhattan Bowery Lodge features free WiFi and a 24-hour front desk. One World Trade Center is 1.5 km away, while Ground Zero is 1.6 km from the property. The nearest airport is LaGuardia Airport, 12 km from the property.

Bowery Grand Hotel provides you with clean room and basic amenities and you decide for yourself where to spend the rest of cash that you saved on fancy hotel. Minutes away from Little Italy, downtown shopping and right around the corner from Williamsburg Bridge. The rest of NYC is at your disposal just few train stops away, two of which by the way we got so close to our hotel so you have to work harder on your mouse scroll to make them apart from us at Google Maps.

The Comfort Inn Lower East Side is perfectly located in the heart of Manhattan and is one of the newly built hotels in the area. The subway station is only a short block away, putting guests within walking distance from downtown, Wall Street and popular New York City hotspots like South Street Seaport, The World Trade Center, Little Italy and the Brooklyn Bridge Park and much more!

The Comfort Inn Lower East Side is perfectly located in the heart of Manhattan and is one of the newly built hotels in the area. The subway station is only a short block away, putting guests within walking distance from downtown, Wall Street and popular New York City hotspots like South Street Seaport, The World Trade Center, Little Italy and the Brooklyn Bridge Park and much more!

Tribeca Blu sits on a busy downtown intersection of Canal Street and Broadway. The location does afford an urban feel with close proximity (walking distance) to trendy neighborhoods like SoHo and Tribeca. If that's not enough choice for food and drink, Chinatown and Little Italy are easy to get to via foot. Guests can also walk a bit farther to get to One World Trade Center and the 9/11 memorial, as well as West, Greenwich, and East Villages.
